page.title: 09 All Saints Church
page.content: {St.Johns Church-Cont music for the hyms.On the altar is a miners lamp and a brass bell from the winding engine of the old pit (coal mine) a reminder of Burnhope's past. {All Saints Church All Saints Church stands in the centre of Lanchester.We visited the church. It was built of stone about 850 years ago.It is older than Durham Cathedral. The original church was built by the Normans.The large arch leading to the chancel is decorated.The original floor was about two metres higher than it is now.Some of the original stained glass windows still survive.These are tiny bits of glass held in place with lead showing Bible pictures.After the Roman invasion about 200 years the church was enlarged with stones from the Roman fort at Lanchester it
